result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L Baumhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds the defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program until served at least 6 years of initial confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant stipulates to the restitution amount.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination thereof to equal full time.

Defendant shall have no contact with Landmark Credit Union or their employees.

Defendant shall have no contact with Alissa F. or Thomas J.

Defendant shall not possess any weapons.

Defendant shall not associate with any known drug users or dealers.

Defendant shall have no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.  

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and make monthly payments.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.

Defendant shall notify medical professionals of addiction history.

Defendant shall use one preapproved doctor and pharmacy, as agreed in advance with the agent, to fill all prescriptions.

Defendant shall cooperate with all conditions and sentences of Federal Probation and any pending charges.

Defendant shall cooperate with mental health evaluation if deemed necessary.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Sentencing hearing at 09-02-2015 01:30 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty David Allan Nelson.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Resolution reached.  On a plea to Ct. 1, State moves to dismiss case 14CM1123; PSI requested, free to argue; State agrees to cap their recommendation to 10 years of initial confinement and takes no position on CIP or SAP programming as long as defendant serves as least 6 years of initial confinement.  WITNESS: Brandon L.B.;   Guilty plea entered.  Colloquy w/ defendant; Court accepts plea, finds defendant guilty, on motion of the state, Court dismisses case 14CM1123.  Court revokes bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Counsel hoping to resolve all cases and trying to expedite discovery demand through Ozaukee Co. case and then more able to determine resolution.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Hearing on February 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty David Allan Nelson.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State request $20,000-25,000.00 cash bond, Atty. Nelson makes bail argument and does not believe family has ability to post cash bond and request a reasonable bail amount.  Court orders $25,000.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.
